verses.verse: (For the choir director. A Psalm of David.) How blessed<WH835> is he who considers<WH7919> the helpless;<WH1800> The Lord<WH3068> will deliver<WH4422> him in a day<WH3117> of trouble.<WH9567>

The Lord<WH3068> will protect<WH8104> him, and keep<WH2421> him alive,<WH2421> And he shall be called<WH833> blessed<WH833> upon the earth;<WH776> And do not give<WH5414> him over to the desire<WH5315> of his enemies.<WH340>
The Lord<WH3068> will sustain<WH5582> him upon his sickbed<WH1741>;<WH6210> In his illness,<WH2483> Thou dost restore<WH2015> him to health.<WH3605> <WH4904>
As for me, I said,<WH559> "O Lord,<WH3068> be gracious<WH2603> to me; Heal<WH7495> my soul,<WH5315> for I have sinned<WH2398> against Thee."
My enemies<WH340> speak<WH559> evil<WH9563> against me, "When<WH4970> will he die,<WH4191> and his name<WH8034> perish?"

And when<WH518> he comes<WH935> to see<WH7200> [me], he speaks<WH1696> falsehood;<WH7723> His heart<WH3820> gathers<WH6908> wickedness<WH205> to itself; When he goes<WH3318> outside,<WH2351> he tells<WH1696> it.
All<WH3605> who hate<WH8130> me whisper<WH3907> together<WH3162> against<WH5921> me; Against<WH5921> me they devise<WH2803> my hurt,<WH9567> [saying,]
"A wicked<WH1100> thing<WH1697> is poured<WH3332> out upon him, That when<WH834> he lies<WH7901> down,<WH7901> he will not rise<WH6965> up again.<WH3254>"
Even<WH1571> my close<WH7965> friend,<WH376> <WH7965> in whom<WH834> I trusted,<WH982> Who ate<WH398> my bread,<WH3899> Has lifted<WH1431> up his heel<WH6119> against<WH5921> me.
But Thou, O Lord,<WH3068> be gracious<WH2603> to me, and raise<WH6965> me up, That I may repay<WH9608> them.
By this<WH384> I know<WH3045> that Thou art pleased<WH2654> with me, Because<WH3588> my enemy<WH340> does not shout<WH7321> in triumph<WH7321> over<WH5921> me.
As for me, Thou dost uphold<WH8551> me in my integrity,<WH8537> And Thou dost set<WH5324> me in Thy presence<WH6440> forever.<WH5769>
Blessed<WH1288> be the Lord,<WH3068> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> From everlasting<WH5769> to everlasting.<WH5769> Amen,<WH543> and Amen.<WH543>
